definition: Lu Xun (1881-1936), one of the earliest and best-known modern Chinese writers
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
rapid/fast

sentences.english: First of all, the teaching target needs to be corrected and reoriented .
sentences.chinese: 首先，要修正教学目标，要重新定位，还原鲁迅。

sentences.english: Luxun had deep love for artistic works all his life, especially in woodcut of block print.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅先生一生热爱美术作品，对版画中木刻兴趣尤甚。

sentences.english: I shall never forget seeing Lu Xun for the first time in 1932.
sentences.chinese: 我永远不会忘记一九三二年第一次见到鲁迅的情景。

sentences.english: Have you ever read any books of Lu Xun?
We must learn from the tenacious fighting spirit of Lu Xun.
sentences.chinese: 我们要学习鲁迅先生韧性的战斗精神。

sentences.english: So Mr. Lu Xun says, China roots in taoism.
sentences.chinese: 所以鲁迅先生才说，中国的根底在道教。

sentences.english: In Lu Xun's eyes, time is a life.
sentences.chinese: 在鲁迅的眼中，时间就如同生命。

sentences.english: Lu Xun had prophesied: "Xiao Hong has been the most promising authoress in China”.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅曾预言“萧红是中国最有前途的女作家”。

sentences.english: Luxun and Hushi are explorer and founder of Chinese modem literature.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅与胡适是新文学的开创者与奠基人。

sentences.english: Again, Lu also showed his leftist mind in his criticism of the Guomingtang authorities.
sentences.chinese: 其次，鲁迅的左倾也体现在对国民党当局的批判中。

sentences.english: Lu Xun's pursuit of the transmutation of human nature, his desire to become Qiu Jin Ah Q.
sentences.chinese: 鲁迅追求的是人性的嬗变，他渴望的是阿Q变成秋瑾。

sentences.english: Lu Xuns perspective of translation constitutes tremendous contribution to the development of translation study in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中国翻译史上，鲁迅曾做出巨大的贡献。

sentences.english: He devoted his whole life to writing the book on LuXun.
sentences.chinese: 他穷尽一生的时间写那本研究鲁迅的书。

sentences.english: George Bernard Shaw is pictured with Lu Xun, the father of modern Chinese fiction, in 1933.
sentences.chinese: 有1933年萧伯纳和中国现代小说之父鲁迅合影。

sentences.english: The struggling spirit influenced Lu Xun's thoughts and his creation.
sentences.chinese: 这种抗争精神也深深地影响了鲁迅的思想和创作。

sentences.english: This paper discusses the artistic value of this technique on basis of Lu Xun's works and other writings.
sentences.chinese: 文章以鲁迅著作及其他书论证了这种手法的艺术价值。

definition: Hu Shi (1891-1962), original proponent of writing in colloquial Chinese 白話文|白话文[bai2 hua4 wen2]

Zhou Zuoren (1885-1967), brother of Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅, academic in Japanese and Greek studies, briefly imprisoned after the war as Japanese collaborator, persecuted and died of unknown causes during the Cultural Revolution
Yu Dafu (1896-1945), poet and novelist
Mao Dun (1896-1981), Chinese novelist
Lao She (1899-1966), Chinese novelist and dramatist
Zhou Shuren, the real name of author Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅
Ba Jin (1904-2005), novelist, author of the trilogy 家, 春, 秋
Cai Yuanpei (1868-1940), liberal educationalist, studied in Germany, president of Peking University 1917-19, minister of education for Guomindang
Zhang Taiyan (1869-1936), scholar, journalist, revolutionary and leading intellectual around the time of the Xinhai revolution
Chen Duxiu (1879-1942), co-founder of the Chinese Communist Party in 1921
Shen Congwen (1902-1988), novelist
Liang Shuming (1893-1988), modern philosopher and teacher in the neo-Confucian tradition
Liang Qichao (1873-1929), influential journalist and a leader of the failed reform movement of 1898
Wen Yiduo (1899-1946), poet and patriotic fighter, executed by Guomindang in Kunming
Guo Moruo (1892-1978), writer, communist party intellectual and cultural apparatchik
Concise History of the Chinese Novel by Lu Xun 鲁迅
pinyin: Zhong1 guo2 Xiao3 shuo1 Shi3 lu:e4
